Module kivakit.data.compression
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.character

Class HuffmanCharacterCodec

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression.codecs.huffman.character.HuffmanCharacterCodec
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, Codec<String>, CharacterCodec, StringCodec, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
public class HuffmanCharacterCodec extends com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater implements CharacterCodec
Huffman compression of an entire sequence of strings using HuffmanCodec to compress individual characters in each string. A Huffman character codec can be created by calling characterCodec(Symbols) or characterCodec(Symbols, Maximum), passing in a symbol set and optionally the maximum number of bits to allow for a code. Compressed bits are written to a ByteList with encode(ByteList, SymbolProducer) and read back with decode(ByteList, SymbolConsumer).

A Huffman character codec can be created by calling characterCodec(Symbols, Maximum) with a set of symbols and their frequencies and a maximum number of bits for the longest allowable code. A codec can also be loaded from a .codec file containing string frequencies with characterCodec(Listener, PropertyMap, Character). For details on how to create codec files, see Symbols.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
